name: pecked
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
peck
[ I or T ] When a bird pecks, it bites, hits, or picks up something small with its beak: The birds learn to peck holes in the milk bottle tops. Geese were pecking around for food. Chickens pecked at the seeds which covered the ground.
[ T ] to give someone a quick kiss, especially on the side of the face: He pecked his aunt on the cheek.
